wikipedia_page.main: John Rodney (Rod) Quayle FRS (1926 – 2006) was a microbial biochemist, West Riding Professor of Microbiology and Head of Department at University of Sheffield (1965 – 1983) and then Vice-Chancellor of Bath University (1983 – 1992). He adopted techniques for dissecting enzymic reactions using radioactive carbon-14. He focused on microbes that used compounds containing one atom of carbon as their sources of energy and biomass.
